rtega_mnemonic:

虽虽		although, even if, reptile, lizard
  • mouth 口 eating insects 虫 like a bird 隹: reptile; even if you see it, it's already gone
  • ⓢ I don't eat 口 insects 虫, although they are edible
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 虽)
Pictophonetic: 隹 indicates the sound; 隹 (bird) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
雖然 [ suī rán ]: although; even though; even if
雖說 [ suī shuō ]: though; although
雖則 [ suī zé ]: nevertheless; although
雖死猶榮 [ suī sǐ yóu róng ]: lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
雖死猶生 [ suī sǐ yóu shēng ]: lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit

    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
heisig_chinese_memo: Although turkeys taste better in my mouth, insects are the future source of food for the world because of their ability to be rapidly farmed.
Ru_trainchinese: suī: (союз) хотя, несмотря на; даже, даже если
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Although it seems nasty, a mouth full of insects can be good for you.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Although " inscriptions from " worm ", " only " sound, the original meaning is a reptile like a lizard. "Shuowen": "Although, it is as big as a lizard. From the insect, only the sound." Later, " though " under the guise of although.

" Although the " character seen in the Spring and Autumn Jin, from CD from insects, the only sound is a symbol, " although ", " CD " on the same rhyme department. " Wei " was originally written as "隹", which was originally a bird's pictogram, and was later borrowed as a speech. "Shuowen" believes that " though " is like a large lizard, and " worm " is the pictogram of a snake, and "lizard" is commonly known as "four-legged snake", so the words in "Shuowen" are not unreasonable.

Inscriptions seen " although " words are words used as fat, although equivalent, meaning there's concession, as new in Qi perplexity: "burnt flint thing, although the mother (no) would break, line Yi (also)," and with " " Wei " and " Wei " are common. Wang Yinzhi's "Jing Chuan Shi Ci": "Wei, the words and words are also used as though." Qin Gongzhong: "Yu Suizi", "Shang Shu. Daguo": "Yuwei Boy". See " Wei " and "隹".
humanum_short_description_en: " Though " was originally a lizard reptile. Later, " though " under the guise of although.
humanum_full_description:
「雖」金文從「虫」，「唯」聲，本義是象蜥蜴的一種爬蟲類動物。《說文》：「雖，似蜥蜴而大。从虫，唯聲。」後假借為雖然的「雖」。

　　「雖」字見於春秋戰國金文，從唯從虫，唯是聲符，「雖」、「唯」上古韻部相同。「唯」初文作「隹」，本來是鳥的象形，後借用作發語詞。《說文》認為「雖」象大蜥蜴之形，按「虫」為蛇的象形，而「蜥蜴」俗稱「四腳蛇」，所以《說文》所言不無道理。

　　金文所見「雖」字皆用作發語詞，相當於雖然，有讓步之意，如新郪虎符：「燔燧事，雖母(毋)會符，行殹(也)。」又與「惟」、「唯」通用，王引之《經傳釋詞》：「惟，發語詞也，亦作雖。」秦公鐘：「余雖小子」，《尚書．大誥》：「予惟小子」。參「唯」、「隹」。
humanum_short_description: 「雖」本是蜥蜴類爬蟲動物。後假借為雖然的「雖」。

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 虽 [ suī ] although, even though
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
①連詞，把意思推開一層，表示“即使”或是“縱然”的意思，後面多有“可是”、“但是”相應：雖然。雖則。麻雀雖小，五臟俱全。
②縱然：爲人民而死，雖死猶生。

「 雖 」金文從「 虫 」，「 唯 」聲，本義是象蜥蜴的一種爬蟲類動物。《說文》：「雖，似蜥蜴而大。从虫，唯聲。」後假借為雖然的「 雖 」。 「 雖 」字見於春秋戰國金文，從唯從虫，唯是聲符，「 雖 」、「 唯 」上古韻部相同。「 唯 」初文作「 隹 」，本來是鳥的象形，後借用作發語詞。《說文》認為「 雖 」象大蜥蜴之形，按「 虫 」為蛇的象形，而「蜥蜴」俗稱「四腳蛇」，所以《說文》所言不無道理。 金文所見「 雖 」字皆用作發語詞，相當於雖然，有讓步之意，如新郪虎符：「燔燧事，雖母(毋)會符，行殹(也)。」又與「 惟 」、「 唯 」通用，王引之《經傳釋詞》：「惟，發語詞也，亦作雖。」秦公鐘：「余雖小子」，《尚書．大誥》：「予惟小子」。參「 唯 」、「 隹 」。

Later, " though" under the guise of although. " Although the" character seen in the Spring and Autumn Jin, from CD from insects, the only sound is a symbol, " although", " CD" on the same rhyme department. " Wei" was originally written as " 隹", which was originally a bird's pictogram, and was later borrowed as a speech. "Shuowen" believes that " though" is like a large lizard, and " worm" is the pictogram of a snake, and "lizard" is commonly known as "four-legged snake", so the words in "Shuowen" are not unreasonable. Inscriptions seen " although" words are words used as fat, although equivalent, meaning there's concession, as new in Qi perplexity: "burnt flint thing, although the mother (no) would break, line Yi (also)," and with " " Wei" and " Wei" are common. 雖字的基本解释

雖
suī
见“虽”。

雖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［suī］
［《廣韻》息遺切，平脂，心。］
“虽1”的繁体字。
(1)虫名。一种有花纹的大蜥蜴。
(2)连词。表示让步关系。犹虽然。
(3)连词。表示假设关系。相当于“縱然”、“即使”。
(4)通“唯”。副词。唯有，只有。
(5)通“唯”。语首助词。
(6)通“須”。副词。本，本来。
[②]［wèi］
“虽2”的繁体字。通“蜼1”。
兽名。

雖字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隹字部】　雖； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1368第22
〔古文〕?【唐韻】息遺切【集韻】【韻會】宣隹切，?音綏。【說文】似蜥蜴而大。从虫唯聲。　又【玉篇】詞兩設也。【廣韻】助語也。【集韻】不定也。况辭也。【爾雅·釋訓】每有，雖也。【註】詩曰：每有良朋，辭之雖也。【禮·少儀】雖請退可也。【疏】雖，假令也。當此时假令請退則可也。　又【玉篇】推也。　又與唯通。《禮記·表記》唯天子受命於天。註：唯當爲雖。又《荀子·性恶篇》今以仁義法正爲固無可知可有之理耶，然則唯禹不知仁義法正，不能仁義法正也。楊僦註：唯，讀爲雖。

考證：〔【註】小雅棠棣曰，每有良朋〕　謹照原文小雅棠棣曰改詩曰。〔【吳語】吾雖之不能，去之不忍。〕　謹按原文作須不作雖。謹節去吳語以下十一字，而於上文少儀疏雖假令也下，照原文增當此时假令請退則可也二句。〔又獸名。【于逖聞奇錄】傅宏業宰天台縣，有人獵得一獸，形如豕，仰鼻，長尾有岐，謂之怪。宏業識之曰，其名雖，非怪也。雨則縣于樹，以尾塞其鼻。驗之，果然。【註】雖，以

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［suī］
["Guang Yun" Xi Yi cut, flat fat, heart. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Shan 1".
(1) Insect name. A large patterned lizard.
(2) Conjunctions. Indicates a concession relationship. Still though.
(3) Conjunctions. Represents a hypothetical relationship. It is equivalent to "Even if" and "Even if".
(4) Through "only". adverb. Only, only.
(5) Through "only". Initial particle.
(6) Through "must". adverb. Ben, originally.
[②]［wèi］
Traditional Chinese characters for "Shan 2". Linked with "蜼1".
Animal name.
although
